EmailTemplate.subject: VMTurbo Trial: Achieving the optimal state
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Dear {{lead.First Name:default=Sir/Madam}},
OOZ is VMTurbo's acronym for the Optimal Operating Zone, the state in which application performance is assured while resources are utilized as efficiently as possible. To achieve it, VMTurbo Operations Manager continuously adjusts and tunes the managed entities across the virtual environment to reduce contention and ensure resources are available. How do we do it and, more importantly, how can you do it? Watch this video <http://www.vmturbo.com/esevideo> to learn more.
If you’re ready to Converge your environment to the OOZ, let’s get going! First, check out the "Achieving OOZ" video <http://www.vmturbo.com/eval-tutorial-converge/> for a demonstration regarding reviewing and following recommendations to improve performance and efficiency. Then, check out the ToDos in the Home Tab to see the specific recommendation proposed by the product, following the top recommendations and reviewing performance improvements. The ToDos in the Home Tab for Improve Efficiency prescribe actions to improve utilization and other inefficiencies.
You can always schedule a demo <http://go.vmturbo.com/request-a-demo.html> with a VMTurbo support engineer, if you’d prefer one of us to walk you through it. And support <http://support.vmturbo.com/home> is just a phone call or email away.
I’ll check back in with you soon.
Thank you,
VMTurbo
